conclusion: To determine the trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval from 0 to t2, we need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph for object B.
The v-t graph shows the velocity of object B as a function of time.
The slope of the v-t graph at any point represents the acceleration of the object at that instant.
At t = 0, the velocity of object B is at its maximum.
As time progresses from 0 to t1, the velocity decreases, indicating a negative slope.
At t = t1, the velocity reaches a minimum (possibly zero or a negative value).
From t1 to t2, the velocity increases, indicating a positive slope.
The negative slope from 0 to t1 indicates that the acceleration is negative (deceleration).
The positive slope from t1 to t2 indicates that the acceleration is positive (acceleration).
From 0 to t1, the acceleration is negative and decreasing (becoming more negative).
At t1, the acceleration is at its most negative (minimum).
From t1 to t2, the acceleration becomes positive and increases.
The acceleration of object B first decreases (becomes more negative) and then increases (becomes positive) during the interval from 0 to t2.
